pr_title: Sb track2 Do not wait till maxWaitTime timeout If no message arrive

timeline.message: SyncClient : Adding short timeout in between messages

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure why this is passed in as a parameter. It seems very specific to a type of algorithm.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: This is not reactive. There are other operations like switch you can use.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.message: Moving the logic of shortTimer to SynchronousReceiveWork
Moving the logic of shortTimer to SynchronousReceiveWork
Moving the logic of shortTimer to SynchronousReceiveWork
move the logic of timeout in worker class
Increasing wait time to 200 MS between messages.

timeline.bodyText: Why not make implement Closeable rather than this private close?
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't need to be a public constant.  It can just live inside the synchronous work class.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: This isn't reactive to have to create a new Mono operation everytime a message come in. How about a combination of Flux.swithOnNext(publisher).takeUntil(notCancelled) where a new item is emitted from the publisher if there is a next message? And for each item emitted, delay at an interval. So if the item is emitted, then cancel the emitter.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText: You don't need any logic to be in here. In the onNext() override, is where you would call emitter.next. And wherever the flux is attached to the Emitter could be the messageReceivedEmitter. MessageReceivedEmitter shouldn't have to exist.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey

timeline.bodyText: When it leaves the scope of the method, doesn't this get collected?
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: is the null check necessary? Isn't this always set in the constructor. You can just call dispose.
timeline.author: conniey
conniey
